Title: Principal Data Scientist
JD:
About the job
    


To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
Job Details
Our Security Data Science team invents, builds and scales new ways to secure Salesforce enterprise and Salesforce platforms and products across multiple public cloud substrates. We use big data and machine learning to advance analytics and threat detection techniques of many forms. We own our solutions, from inception, through proof-of-concept, production-ready models, tuning and efficacy monitoring. We are a growing, highly visible, and highly agile team where experimentation, collaboration, and spirited discussion are the norm!
We are looking for an experienced, driven, and creative Data Scientist to join the team. As a member of this team, you’ll research, formulate, build and test new techniques in threat detection and analysis. You’ll partner with threat specialists to understand evolving threat patterns and their detection. You’ll help develop statistical models and big data applications to identify anomalous or malicious behavior through mining vast sources of internal and external data. You’ll play a key role in championing your research and the larger teams’ with executive partners. You’ll provide periodic efficacy measurement, analysis, and reporting for deployed techniques. 
About You
You’re intensely curious about data and highly adept in analyzing large volumes of data, then teasing out valuable signals therein. You’re able to seamlessly merge rigor in statistics with awareness of their application to business problems. You thrive in researching, experimenting with, applying, and proving out new techniques in machine learning and data mining. You maintain a healthy curiosity and investment in keeping abreast of emerging techniques. You collaborate effectively across security teams and software engineers to champion proven detection techniques and detection efficacy. 
Required Skills
A related technical degree required.Demonstrated experience in machine learning and data miningExperience formulating and executing applied-research projects and assisting in their production implementation. Strong fundamentals in applied statistics and probability Facility with big data analytics tools and distributed systems, Apache Spark, Flink, or Kafka Strong programming skills in Python, Java, or ScalaExcellent interpersonal skillsPrior knowledge of Security is not required
Preferred Skills
Experience in applying big-data techniques to security, specifically in anomaly detection, pattern recognition, behavior-based analysis, and correlation. Good knowledge with network technologies, such as TCP/IP, DNS or load balancerPrior experience in the security spaceExperience with public cloud services (AWS or Google Cloud Platform or Azure)
For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $144,700. You may also be entitled to receive bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits.
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

Title: Big Data Platform Development- Senior/Lead/Principal Engineer
JD:
About the job
    


To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
Note: By applying to the Software Engineering Big Data Platform posting, recruiters and hiring managers across the organization hiring Software Engineer will review your resume. Our goal is for you to apply once and have your resume reviewed by multiple hiring teams.
Interested in being part of one of the biggest Big Data platforms at massive scale running on public and private cloud substrates? Salesforce is building out our Big Data Platform Services team to reinvigorate the way we architect, deliver, and operate the platforms and services that run in our own data centers and also in public clouds - at consumer web scale! We are looking to add engineers and leads, with experience building and owning distributed services, who can step up and own big chunks of this vision.
Your Impact
Working with Phoenix, HBase, Mapreduce, Yarn, Kafka, Spark, Hive, Presto, or equivalent large-scale distributed systems technologies on a modern containerized deployment stack using Kubernetes, Spinnaker, and other technologiesEnjoy the opportunity to become an Open Source contributor by being part of teams that have PMCs and committers on various Apache projectsExperience building Big Data services on AWS, GCP or other public cloud substratesEat, sleep, and breathe services. You have experience balancing live-site management, feature delivery, and retirement of technical debtDesigning, developing, debugging, and operating resilient distributed systems that run across thousands of compute nodes in multiple datacentersParticipate in the team’s on-call rotation to address complex problems in real-time and keep services operational and highly available
Required Skills
A related technical degree requiredExperience with Java, C++, and/or Python in a Linux/UNIX data center environmentExperience owning and operating multiple instances of a critically important serviceExperience with Agile development methodology and Test-Driven DevelopmentExperience using telemetry and metrics to drive operational excellenceHave strong, heartfelt opinions on CAP theorem, can sketch out four different consistency models on a single napkin and defend each of them, and understand Paxos, Raft, and Zookeeper at an implementation level
Open to Fully Remote, Flex (1-3 days/week in the office), or Office-Based (4-5 days/week in office)
For Colorado-based roles: Minimum annual salary of $98,900. You may also be offered a bonus, restricted stock units, and benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://salesforcebenefits.com/us/candidate.html

Try Premium for freeActively recruiting     Apply         Save            Save Summer 2023 Intern, Data Analyst (Business Technology) at Salesforce
Title: Summer 2023 Intern, Data Analyst (Business Technology)
JD:
About the job
    


To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
About Futureforce University Recruiting
Our Futureforce University Recruiting program is dedicated to attracting, retaining and cultivating talent. Our interns and new graduates work on real projects that affect how our business runs, giving them the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the future of our company. With offices all over the world, our recruits have the chance to collaborate and connect with fellow employees on a global scale. We offer job shadowing, mentorship programs, talent development courses, and much more.
Job Category
Intern
Job Details
Job Description
Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win.
Description
Have you mastered the balance between creativity and technology? Do you want to be part of a company that is changing the way software is developed and used? As a summer intern you will have the opportunity to work on the Salesforce platform and see the capabilities it has. You will be part of a team that ensures that the Salesforce platform is up and running for our employees. In this role you will help resolve important and high visibility production issues; come up with innovative solutions and automation for the current manual work that the team performs. The successful candidate must be analytical, curious to understand what is behind the problem, agile and able to support multiple priorities.
Salesforce is working towards treating data like an enterprise asset through enabling our customers to better understand, manage, measure, and trust BT data assets through cataloging, data quality analysis, and master data management. The purpose and vision for Data Management is to provide tools and processes that allow for BT data to be trusted, integrated, and timely assets for business operations, intelligence and decision making. Additionally, Business Technology (BT) teams focus on data & analytics around operational excellence, our people, our delivery portfolio and budget/spend. We aim to provide the Leadership Team with the information they need to enable excellent execution while balancing capacity and employee well-being. We bring technical expertise in data management, data analytics and Tableau as needed. We are known for our good judgment and partnering skills.
Responsibilities Could Include
Work with engineers for enterprise metrics catalog. Participate in cloud-migration activities. Partner with other data teams for data quality and data management alignment. Work with product managers for epic, stories definitions and validation test cases. Work with business partners for cross functional requirements understanding. Partner with end uses for stories & work validation and testing. Analyze data, conduct surveys, participate in focus groups and other meetings to facilitate the gathering of business needs and requirements.Prepare presentations summarizing data insights and trends that can be incorporated into execution plans. Present to executive stakeholders and leadership teams. Build out execution plans and track progress against plans.Support maturity of data, tools & Tableau application to support leadership team. Drive data maturity from identified systems.Factor data access rights, security and processes.Partner with Sr Portfolio Manager to build new innovative new Dashboards in the LT Tableau Server Dashboard environmentBuild Proof of concept using Python and SQL on Snowflake. 
Required Skills
Enrolled and working towards a BS in Data Analytics, Computer Science or related field (must be attending a university in North America). Please note, to be eligible for an internship, you must be returning to school for at least one quarter/semester after the internship is completed and we are not considering MS students at this timeStrong analytical skills and a curious mindset to learn new technologies/conceptsExceptional research skills and resourcefulness, Strong technical problem-solving skills, with an ability to troubleshoot complex application issuesUnderstanding of business processes and ability to translate business requirements into application functionalityGood understanding of RDBMS concepts and SQLExperience with Web services SOAP ,WSDL and Rest servicesStrong written and oral communication skillsGood understanding of API governance tools and concepts.Strong team player with a service-oriented attitude and customer focusComfortable bending between the tactical and strategicExcellent at framing problems to inspire a beginner’s mindset and creative solutions
Desired Skills
Understanding of cloud data warehouse (e.g. Redshift, Snowflake etc.)Salesforce.com Certifications - Administration or DeveloperData mining and analytics

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

Job Description
Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. Description
Have you mastered the balance between creativity and technology? Do you want to be part of a company that is changing the way software is developed and used? As a summer intern you will have the opportunity to work on the Salesforce platform and see the capabilities it has. You will be part of a team that ensures that the Salesforce platform is up and running for our employees. In this role you will help resolve important and high visibility production issues; come up with innovative solutions and automation for the current manual work that the team performs. The successful candidate must be analytical, curious to understand what is behind the problem, agile and able to support multiple priorities.
Salesforce is working towards treating data like an enterprise asset through enabling our customers to better understand, manage, measure, and trust BT data assets through cataloging, data quality analysis, and master data management. Work with engineers for enterprise metrics catalog. Participate in cloud-migration activities. Partner with other data teams for data quality and data management alignment. Work with product managers for epic, stories definitions and validation test cases. Work with business partners for cross functional requirements understanding. Partner with end uses for stories & work validation and testing. Analyze data, conduct surveys, participate in focus groups and other meetings to facilitate the gathering of business needs and requirements.Prepare presentations summarizing data insights and trends that can be incorporated into execution plans. Present to executive stakeholders and leadership teams. Build out execution plans and track progress against plans.Support maturity of data, tools & Tableau application to support leadership team. Drive data maturity from identified systems.Factor data access rights, security and processes.Partner with Sr Portfolio Manager to build new innovative new Dashboards in the LT Tableau Server Dashboard environmentBuild Proof of concept using Python and SQL on Snowflake. 
Required Skills
Enrolled and working towards a BS in Data Analytics, Computer Science or related field (must be attending a university in North America). Desired Skills
Understanding of cloud data warehouse (e.g. Redshift, Snowflake etc.)Salesforce.com Certifications - Administration or DeveloperData mining and analytics
